reasoning: Familial periodic paralysis is a rare autosomal dominant channelopathy. Prevalence estimated at 1-2 per 100,000 globally based on limited genetic epidemiology studies and disease registries. Reported as prevalence (chronic genetic condition with lifelong manifestations) rather than incidence. Includes subtypes: hypokalemic (most common, ~70%), hyperkalemic (~20%), and thyrotoxic.
source: Fontaine B et al. (2018). Periodic paralysis and related channelopathies. Neuromuscul Disord. Expert reviews on rare channelopathies and genetic muscle disorders.
